Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about the history of international graphic design and different artistic movements.

I learned a great deal about both the history of graphic design, as well as many technical aspects. Reviewing historical design movements both provided me with a better understanding of modern design principles and helped me to broaden my understanding of the purpose of design to, first and foremost, communicate. On the technical side of things, I learned a great deal over the course of the two main projects, including small details regarding leading, printing, color design, and more.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: Prof. Scott is a fantastic teacher with a ton of insight on historical and technical aspects of design. Project designs were informed by historical design movements, which greatly helped my own work. Prof. Scott prioritized looking towards successful designs of the past, which improved my own work.

Weaknesses: sometimes the lectures were a bit slow-moving. Found myself watching on 1.25 speed occasionally. Perhaps having fewer lectures per week would be better.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I enjoyed the live lecture and critique format.
The combination of lecture and seminar/review periods worked very well, and enabled us to cover a ton of content quickly.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course. Doug is a gem and so full of knowledge.

If youre at all interested in design, this is a fantastic course. While by no means required, I would recommend taking other design courses first to make sure you have an interest in the fieldbecause the content was so specialized, I dont think this would be a good course for complete newcomers.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual lectures + weekly 2 hour seminar/lab style meetings
